meanings.definition: To have stayed overnight in a tent or shelter outdoors.
meanings.sent1: We camped by the lake during our vacation.
meanings.sent2: The family camped in the forest for the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The bears camped near the river, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent4: The stars camped in the sky, twinkling brightly at night.
meanings.sent5: The scouts camped under the stars, telling stories around the fire.

meanings.definition: To have set up a temporary shelter or campsite.
meanings.sent1: They camped a tent in the backyard for the sleepover.
meanings.sent2: The hikers camped a fire pit for cooking meals.
meanings.sent3: The birds camped on the tree branches, chirping happily.
meanings.sent4: The clouds camped in the sky, blocking the sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: The explorers camped a base in the mountains, preparing for the climb.

meanings.definition: To have lodged temporarily in a camp.
meanings.sent1: The travelers camped at the rest stop for the night.
meanings.sent2: The group camped in the designated area of the national park.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels camped in the hollow of the tree, safe from predators.
meanings.sent4: The memories camped in her mind, bringing back nostalgic feelings.
meanings.sent5: The team camped at the competition site, ready to showcase their skills.
